特記事項: 【合併】英語IIｄ　１２（経済学部）/英語IVｂ　１２（経済学部）
授業の概要・背景: The focus of this class is vocabulary, speaking, grammar, listening and reading. In each lesson, students will develop their ability to communicate in English by speaking in pairs or in small groups. The content of the lesson is based on the textbook, but students will sometimes participate in extra communication activities.  Students should be prepared for frequent discussion activities, in which they will learn and practice appropriate language for a range of communication situations (for example: asking for opinions, expressing opinions, disagreeing, offering advice, persuading others, etc.). Students will be expected to participate in an 'English only' learning environment.
授業方法:
We will be a face-to-face class. 

The instructor will be a facilitator of various tasks to help students connect with each other and speak English. There will be ample opportunity for pair work.

Discussion: Students hold discussions in class. In addition to discussions between pairs of students, group discussions are sometimes held as well.

Presentation: As the main activities, students summarize the results of their own learning activities and present them.

Pair work: Students perform learning activities in pairs.

Group work: Students make groups of three members or more to perform learning activities.

第1回: Introduction, Mr. Michael Lin’s hello, hello! Say hi to your classmates! Set-up the Microsoft Teams and Slack App.
第2回: Unit 7 – What do you use your smartphone for?

HW #1 Due – Buy the textbook. Make sure you can check Luna. Make sure you can access your KGU e-mail account. Make sure you have the Microsoft Teams and Slack app. *Homework may be adjusted depending on how the class goes.
第3回: Unit 7 – What do I do now? Choose groups.
第4回: Unit 8 – Time to celebrate! What’s your favorite holiday or festival?
HW #2 is due – Unit 7 WB Pg. 37 – 42. Write your English name, take photos of the completed pages, attach, and submit on MS Teams. Choose groups.
第5回: Unit 8 – What’s a modern / traditional wedding like? Choose topics.
第6回: Unit 9 – Only time will tell. Talk about the past, present, and future. Review and Quiz #1 - Unit 7 and 8 (20%) Submit on MS Teams.
HW #3 is due – Unit 8 WB Pg. 43 – 48. Write your English name, take photos of the completed pages, attach, and submit on MS Teams. Choose topics.
第7回: Unit 9 – If you get a high-paying job, what will you do? Choose sources.
第8回: Unit 10 – I like working with people. So do I!
HW #4 is due – Unit 9 WB Pg. 49 – 54. Write your English name, take photos of the completed pages, attach, and submit on MS Teams. Choose sources.
第9回: Unit 10 – What kind of work would you like to do? Choose dates.
第10回: Unit 11 – It’s really worth seeing! What? Review and Quiz #2 - Unit 9 and 10 (20%) Submit on MS Teams.
HW #5 is due – Unit 10 WB Pg. 55 – 60. Write your English name, take photos of the completed pages, attach, and submit on MS Teams. Choose dates.
第11回: Unit 11 – What do you want to know? Presentation script.
第12回: Final Oral Assessment Preparation - Mr. Lin would like students to make a live presentation (group) talking about a topic from Unit 7 to 11 or a subject students are interested in. Each student should speak for at least 2 minutes and 30 seconds. Write about 250 words for 2 minutes and 30 seconds of speech. Prepare a PowerPoint presentation (5 - 6 slides). Edit and practice your delivery. (2-member group = 5 minutes; 3-member group = 7 minutes and 30 seconds). Bring your PCs!

HW #6 Due - Submit the first draft of your script with all the members' content on a Word document and submit the first draft of your PPT slides. Submit on MS Teams. (All HW Submissions 20%) Presentation script.
第13回: Final Oral Assessment - 30%. Mr. Lin would like students to make a live presentation (group) talking about a topic from Unit 7 to 11 or a subject students are interested in. Each student should speak for at least 2 minutes and 30 seconds. (2-member group = 5 minutes; 3-member group = 7 minutes and 30 seconds).

The evening (10pm) before the final oral assessment please send your final script with both members' content on a Word document and submit your final PPT slides through a resubmission of HW #6 or through the Slack App.
第14回: (Make up and feedback) Final Oral Assessment - 30%. Mr. Lin would like students to make a live presentation (group) talking about a topic from Unit 7 to 11 or a subject students are interested in. Each student should speak for at least 2 minutes and 30 seconds. (2-member group = 5 minutes; 3-member group = 7 minutes and 30 seconds). Final class feedback.
トピック.授業計画1: Students at times you may need a laptop computer or a portable device with wifi connection. Be sure you can access Luna, KWIC,Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Slack, your KGU e-mail address, and have a Google account.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are required to prepare for class and when appropriate review. Students are required to bring their textbook, a pen or pencil, paper, and a dictionary to class. There is homework in the course and all homework will be facilitated through the Microsoft Teams App and Assignments function. Expect to spend about 30 minutes each week previewing and reviewing the textbook contents. Expect to spend an additional 1 hour every other week or 30 minutes each week completing homework assignments.

評価.教科書Required texts0: Interchange 2 (5th Edition), by Jack C. Richards, Cambridge University Press, 2017, ISBN: 978-1-316-62023-6
評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。

評価.備考Note0: Students are expected to speak English only in class. You will not pass the course if you miss more than five (5) classes. If you are more than five (5) minutes late for class, you will be considered late. Three (3) lates will equal one (1) absence. An absence or tardy is only excused when documentation is provided by Kyomu (Academic Affairs Office). Mr. Lin's e-mail is fts77833@kwansei.ac.jp. There is homework in the course and just about all homework will be facilitated through the Microsoft Teams App and Assignments function. If there are exceptions Mr. Lin will let students know. Homework should always be submitted (usually at the beginning of class) on the day that it's due. All tasks of the class should be completed by their due dates. Mr. Lin does not allow students to mass submit (a semester's worth of work) at the end of classes or after the end classes.

name: 【200】英語IVｂ　１２／English IVb
担当者: リン　マイケル　Ｐ．（LIN MICHAEL P.）
成績評価備考:
備考　Note
Class Participation – 10%
Assignments – 20%
Quiz #1 – 20%
Quiz #2 - 20%
Final Oral Assessment - 30%
Total - 100%

Average Grades For The Department - 70 - 75

The student's grade will be based on quizzes, writing assignments, and oral presentations. No final exam will be given during the exam period. Those students who miss five or more classes during the term will receive 0 points for this course.
